Technical Skills: Healthcare professionals will apply technical skills required for all career specialties. They
will demonstrate skills and knowledge as appropriate.

458732D3E5D44FEDB578C5E318C3C17C.description:
Health Maintenance Practices: Healthcare professionals will understand the fundamentals of wellness and the prevention
of disease processes. They will practice preventive health behaviors among their clients.

1FA1A1A58B1B402783793164DEBFFFC6.description: Act responsibly as a team member.

E7C7CAA390B341888578C5C7DED4B3C5.description: Discuss methods for building positive team relationships.

B7CCDF8CDFCF4D6DBD962A83C909D2E6.description: Demonstrate effective collaboration as members of an interdisciplinary team.

832C82EF102A4D4592D4A86290C54E68.description:
Teamwork: Healthcare professionals will understand the roles and responsibilities of individual
members as part of the healthcare team, including their ability to promote the delivery of
quality healthcare. They will interact effectively and sensitively will all members of the
healthcare team.

E06653FE2813478FB7797C60D340D1F5.description:
Demonstrate appropriate use of infectious disease control measures as established
by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Center for
Disease Control (CDC).

Discuss the importance of appropriate inspections and maintenance of sports
equipment.

9810F7E66CE7450798BA0C183D9C5F20.description:
Explain the importance of appropriate sports medicine and athletic facility
inspections and maintenance.

7BDB4DAE89DC47889223DFB9431B00DF.description: Apply principles of personal safety practices to include

7149EEA81EF04E6B93AB27F78BEE941C.description:
Safety Practices: Healthcare professionals will understand the existing and potential hazards to clients,
coworkers, and self. They will prevent injury or illness through safe work practices and
follow health and safety policies and procedures.

529AFF358E5044CAB3F5772D294A3568.description:
Differentiate between ethical and legal issues and practices impacting sports
medicine professionals.

47D5A49B413B478CBF695CB93E6F7733.description:
Identify responsible practices within the ethical framework of the sports
medicine profession.

587048BFEAA64A5D8A03DBEA2F00D73D.description:
Critique ethical, respectful, and empathetic behaviors throughout scenarios
presented in class and lab activities.

FFFB337590BB4ACF969B512016E2BFBF.description:
Ethics: Healthcare professionals will understand accepted ethical practices with respect to
cultural, social, and ethnic differences within the healthcare environment. They will
perform quality healthcare delivery.

AD19650076C9458696A7CC0710C5FD2A.description:
Review the “Good Samaritan Law” and how it relates to lay persons vs. licensed
medical professionals.

317D117249754821889226AFCF2D5EA1.description: Understand Title IX and how it relates to equity in sports.

523D7DBB903F43A5AA146F419D533488.description: Explain the laws governing harassment, labor, and employment.

E8DF1B7845314F81927807B6D3CFB51A.description: Explore a “Patient’s Bill of Rights” and “Athlete’s Bill of Rights.”

F30E383B86EF4BE880E47D47A50F7C36.description: Apply procedures for proper documentation and storage of medical records.

BE16226CA11342B4BD9C404917F599A8.description:

Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Federal Education Rights and
Privacy Act (FERPA), and the importance of maintaining patient confidentiality.

Compare and contrast scope of practice among regulated healthcare
professionals, students, and other individuals.

and legislated rights of patients.

8456568CBA804C98988ACD9999442E66.description:
Legal Responsibilities: Healthcare professionals will understand the legal responsibilities, limitations, and
implications of their actions within the healthcare delivery setting. They will perform their
duties according to regulations, policies, laws, and legislated rights of clients.

15A848F594D440F6AFA1180B9D77F25C.description:
Demonstrate basic professional standards as they apply to hygiene, dress,
language, confidentiality, and behavior.

06AEEC02BCE14C8696A4876BCA21BF93.description: Develop a job description for a sports medicine related career.

Employability Skills: Healthcare professionals will understand how employability skills enhance their
employment opportunities and job satisfaction. They will demonstrate key employability
skills and will maintain and upgrade skills as needed.

1B2C1A2C972A4298AB831D0C0158B627.description:

program.

521730598CC14BD28998B2449015D9F0.description:
Systems: Healthcare professionals will understand how their role fits into their department, their
organization, and the overall healthcare environment. They will identify how key
systems affect services they perform and quality of care.

Engage in active listening and demonstrate comprehension of verbal
instructions, requests, and other information to verify accuracy.

Create an injury report using the SOAP Note (Subjective, Objective,
Assessment, Plan) format.

34E0DD6900D84E5798BDFA3ECF42083E.description:
Communications: Healthcare professionals will know the various methods of giving and obtaining
information. They will communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.

Describe considerations for treating injuries in various stages of the healing
process.

including:

Describe the process of dealing with catastrophic injury and death in
athletics.

Describe the components of the evaluation process, such as history,
observation, palpation, and special tests.

Describe the general medical conditions and injuries of the following body systems,
which affect or are common to athletic participation: cardiovascular, respiratory, muscular, skeletal, nervous, gastrointestinal, excretory, reproductive, endocrine, and
integumentary (skin).

Academic Foundation: Healthcare professionals will know the academic subject matter required for proficiency
within their area. They will use this knowledge as needed in their role. The following
accountability criteria are considered essential for students in a sports medicine program of
study.
